requirement_tested: A dashboard website for displaying regulatory policies
user_persona: A compliance officer who needs to quickly access and review current regulatory policies.
user_goal: To navigate to the dashboard and view a list of regulatory policies.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing the Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens her browser and navigates to the regulatory policy dashboard website.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard loads with a lavender background and indigo UI elements, showing a grid of policy cards.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Policy Cards
narrative_steps.description: Sarah scans the main content area and sees several policy cards displayed in a grid format.
narrative_steps.action: Visually inspect the policy grid.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each policy card displays the title, category, status, and key metrics of a regulatory policy.

requirement_tested: Data visualization capabilities for complex regulatory policies
user_persona: A policy analyst who relies on visual data to understand policy impacts.
user_goal: To examine interactive charts representing policy data.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Charts Section
narrative_steps.description: John notices the right sidebar contains data visualizations related to the selected policy.
narrative_steps.action: Look at the right sidebar for charts.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Multiple interactive charts are visible, each with an indigo header and rendered using Chart.js.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Chart Tooltips
narrative_steps.description: John hovers over segments of a pie chart to see more detailed information.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over chart elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltips appear showing precise values and additional context about the data points.

user_persona: A new intern tasked with compiling a report on various policies.
user_goal: To explore different policies available on the dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Policy List
narrative_steps.description: Emma scrolls through the list of policy cards displayed on the dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll vertically through the policy grid.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: More policy cards load or become visible as she scrolls down the page.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Policy
narrative_steps.description: Emma finds a policy titled 'Data Privacy Compliance' and decides to view its details.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the policy card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She is redirected to the detailed view page for that specific policy.

requirement_tested: Ability to analyze policies with related data and charts
user_persona: A senior analyst preparing a briefing document for stakeholders.
user_goal: To gather supporting data and visual representations for a specific policy.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Detailed View
narrative_steps.description: Michael clicks on a policy card to see comprehensive details and associated metrics.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a policy card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The detailed policy view loads, showing full description, metadata, and related data tables.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Related Charts
narrative_steps.description: Michael looks at the charts section on the detail page to understand trends and distributions.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect the interactive charts displayed.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Charts accurately reflect the policy's data and update dynamically when interacted with.

user_persona: A compliance manager needing to focus on active policies only.
user_goal: To filter the policy list to show only active policies.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Filter Panel
narrative_steps.description: Lisa identifies the filter panel on the left sidebar and expands the 'Status' filter group.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Status' filter section header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The filter options under 'Status' are revealed, including checkboxes for Active, Inactive, and Proposed.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: Lisa checks the 'Active' checkbox to narrow down the displayed policies.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Active' checkbox.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The policy grid immediately updates to show only policies marked as active.

user_persona: A regulatory researcher organizing policies chronologically.
user_goal: To sort the policy list by effective date in ascending order.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Sort Controls
narrative_steps.description: Robert looks at the row of headers above the policy grid to find sorting options.
narrative_steps.action: Locate the 'Effective Date' column header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The 'Effective Date' header is clearly labeled and styled in indigo.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Sort
narrative_steps.description: Robert clicks the 'Effective Date' header once to begin sorting.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Effective Date' header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Policies are reordered from earliest to latest effective date, indicated by an upward arrow icon.

requirement_tested: Frontend that fetches all data from backend APIs
user_persona: A developer verifying integration between frontend and backend services.
user_goal: To confirm that policy data is loaded dynamically via API calls.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Initial Data
narrative_steps.description: Alex refreshes the dashboard page and observes network activity in browser dev tools.
narrative_steps.action: Refresh the dashboard page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Network tab shows GET requests made to /api/policies and other related endpoints to fetch data.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Dynamic Content
narrative_steps.description: Alex confirms that no hardcoded data exists and all content comes from API responses.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect page source and network responses.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Policy data matches exactly what was returned by the backend API without any static placeholders.

requirement_tested: Backend that connects to an external PostgreSQL database
user_persona: A DevOps engineer validating backend connectivity setup.
user_goal: To ensure the backend service properly connects to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Environment Configuration
narrative_steps.description: Taylor reviews the backend server's environment configuration file.
narrative_steps.action: Verify presence of DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, and DB_NAME variables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Environment variables match the required values: localhost, 5432, myappuser, myapppassword, myapp.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Database Connection
narrative_steps.description: Taylor triggers an API call that requires querying the database.
narrative_steps.action: Make a request to /api/policies endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server successfully retrieves and returns real-time data from the connected PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Use of specified environment variables for database connection: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp
user_persona: A deployment specialist ensuring secure credential handling.
user_goal: To verify correct usage of predefined environment variables for database authentication.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Backend Code
narrative_steps.description: Jordan inspects the backend code where database connections are established.
narrative_steps.action: Check database connection logic in backend files.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Database connection uses environment variables instead of hardcoded credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Variable Values
narrative_steps.description: Jordan verifies that the actual runtime environment has the correct variable assignments.
narrative_steps.action: Echo or print environment variables during backend startup.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Output shows DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

requirement_tested: Lavender background color assigned to the website
user_persona: A UX designer auditing visual consistency across platforms.
user_goal: To validate consistent use of lavender as the primary background color.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Patricia examines the overall site layout focusing on background styling.
narrative_steps.action: Open developer tools and inspect body or main container styles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Background color is set to #E6E6FA which corresponds to lavender.

narrative_steps.title: Cross-Device Verification
narrative_steps.description: Patricia views the dashboard on desktop and mobile devices to check consistency.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window and switch between device modes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Lavender background remains consistent regardless of screen size or orientation.

requirement_tested: Indigo color assigned to UI elements
user_persona: A brand compliance reviewer checking adherence to company guidelines.
user_goal: To confirm that indigo is used consistently for UI components like buttons and headers.

narrative_steps.title: Analyzing UI Element Colors
narrative_steps.description: Derek focuses on top navigation bars, filter headers, and chart titles to assess color usage.
narrative_steps.action: Use browser inspection tool to check CSS properties of UI elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: UI components utilize #4B0082 (indigo) for text or background colors as per design specs.

narrative_steps.title: Validating Interactive States
narrative_steps.description: Derek interacts with elements such as hover states and active selections.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over and click interactive UI elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Indigo theme persists across different interaction states maintaining visual coherence.

requirement_tested: Configuration of package.json with 'npm run install:all' script to install both frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A new team member setting up their local development environment.
user_goal: To run a single command that installs all necessary dependencies for both frontend and backend.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Morgan clones the repository and runs the custom installation command.
narrative_steps.action: Execute 'npm run install:all' from terminal in project root.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend directories have their dependencies installed automatically.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Installation Success
narrative_steps.description: Morgan checks if node_modules folders exist in both frontend and backend directories.
narrative_steps.action: List contents of frontend/node_modules and backend/node_modules.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies listed in respective package.json files are present in each node_modules folder.

requirement_tested: Configuration of package.json with 'npm run dev' script to start both frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A developer beginning daily work requiring simultaneous frontend and backend execution.
user_goal: To launch both development servers using one unified command.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Casey opens terminal and initiates concurrent development environments.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run dev' from the project root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Terminal output indicates both frontend and backend servers are starting concurrently.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Server Outputs
narrative_steps.description: Casey watches the console logs to ensure both services initialize correctly.
narrative_steps.action: Observe terminal messages from both frontend and backend processes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Logs from both applications appear together, confirming successful parallel startup.

requirement_tested: Interactive charts and graphs for policy data representation
user_persona: An executive presenting findings to leadership based on dashboard insights.
user_goal: To manipulate and interpret interactive charts for presentation purposes.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Chart Interactivity
narrative_steps.description: Jamie hovers over parts of a line graph to get precise figures.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over data points on the chart canvas.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltip windows pop up displaying exact numerical values and timestamps.

narrative_steps.title: Customizing Chart Display
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks on legend items to toggle visibility of certain data series.
narrative_steps.action: Click on items within the chart legend.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Selected data series disappear or reappear on the chart accordingly.

requirement_tested: Responsive design compatible with multiple device sizes
user_persona: A remote worker accessing the dashboard on various personal devices.
user_goal: To seamlessly use the dashboard whether on desktop, tablet, or smartphone.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Layout Adaptation
narrative_steps.description: Riley resizes the browser window to simulate smaller screens.
narrative_steps.action: Adjust browser window width manually or use responsive mode in dev tools.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts appropriately; sidebars stack vertically, fonts resize, and touch targets remain accessible.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Mobile Usability
narrative_steps.description: Riley views the dashboard on an actual smartphone to evaluate usability.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the dashboard URL on a mobile phone.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard renders cleanly, navigation is intuitive, and interactive features function smoothly on small screens.
